title: Web3 faces regulatory hurdles in Africa, hindering transformative potential
description:
Developer advocate of Cartesi, a Web3 rollup protocol, Jathin Jagannath expressed the importance of improved digital literacy, stating that a skilled workforce and user base are crucial for successfully integrating Web3 technologies.

Developer advocate of Cartesi, a Web3 rollup protocol, Jathin Jagannath, has noted regulatory uncertainties as a significant hurdle in Africa‚Äôs Web3 landscape. According to Jathin, the absence of clear, well-defined regulations surrounding Web3 technologies can create hesitancy among potential users and investors.

In an interview with Cointelegraph, Jathin stressed that the regulatory ambiguity may result in a reluctance to fully embrace the transformative possibilities that Web3 offers. He said,

Africa is a continent with a vast potential for Web3 adoption and innovation. According to a recent report by PwC and Emurgo Africa 2023 on the ‚ÄúState of Web3 in Africa,‚Äù blockchain funding across Africa increased by 1,668 percent in 2022, with Kenya, Nigeria, and South Africa leading the continent‚Äôs Web3 adoption.
